void deck_destroy (T_deck *d)
 Deletes the deck a all cards in it. Does not delete data referenced by the cards.

void deck_shuffle (T_deck *d)
 shuffles the given T_deck d, and resets dealt field. Does not modify the card ordinal or data fields.

T_deck_card * deck_deal (T_deck *d, int blackjack)
 returns the next card in the deck, advances the dealt field, automatically reshuffling, as needed unless "blackjack" mode is set

T_deck_card * deck_peek (T_deck *d, int blackjack)
 returns the next card in the deck without advancing "dealt". Allows the caller peek at the next card without actually dealing it. This can result in the deck shuffling unless blackjack is set, or NULL if blackjack is set and the deck is out of cards.

Detailed Description

Type and function declarations for "deck_" Deck of cards API.

Function Documentation

T_deck* deck_create (  size_t    size,
unsigned int    seed,
void *    data,
size_t    dsize
) 
 

Allocates an deck of cards and initializes them with ordinal and data.

The ord (ordinal) field of each card is set to a zero based index of the card in the deck of card array. This value can freely be changed to suit the needs of the calling program, and is initialized as a convenience.

If parameter data is non-null, the data field of each card is set to data + ordinal * dsize. Thus, each card points to consectutive entries in an array of data elements of size dsize. Again this data can be freely modified after create to suit the needs of the calling program

Parameters:
size  number of cards in the deck created
seed  the seed to use for this deck
data  array of data to map to T_deck_card::data, NULL indicates none
dsize  the stride of the data array (if non-NULL)
Returns:
the created deck

T_deck_card* deck_deal (  T_deck *    d,
int    blackjack
) 
 

returns the next card in the deck, advances the dealt field, automatically reshuffling, as needed unless "blackjack" mode is set

Parameters:
d  the deck to deal
blackjack  don't shuffle at end of deck, instead return NULL
Returns:
the card on the top of the deck or NULL if blackjack and out of cards.

void deck_destroy (  T_deck *    d ) 
 

Deletes the deck a all cards in it. Does not delete data referenced by the cards.

Parameters:
d  the deck delete

T_deck_card* deck_peek (  T_deck *    d,
int    blackjack
) 
 

returns the next card in the deck without advancing "dealt". Allows the caller peek at the next card without actually dealing it. This can result in the deck shuffling unless blackjack is set, or NULL if blackjack is set and the deck is out of cards.

Parameters:
d  the deck to deal
blackjack  don't shuffle at end of deck, instead return NULL
Returns:
the card on the top of the deck

void deck_shuffle (  T_deck *    d ) 
 

shuffles the given T_deck d, and resets dealt field. Does not modify the card ordinal or data fields.

Parameters:
d  the deck to shuffle
